did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Wythe County (Va.) List of Free Negroes within the District of Joseph J. Graham, 1838.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Wythe County (Va.) List of Free Negroes within the District of Joseph J. Graham, 1838. Local government records collection, Wythe County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: These items came to the Library of Virginia under accession number 36884.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Wythe County was named for George Wythe, a signer of the Declaration of Independence and chancellor of Virginia in 1789 when Wythe County was formed from Montgomery County. Part of Grayson County was added later.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Wythe County (Va.) List of Free Negroes within the District of Joseph J. Graham, 1838. The list was compiled by Graham, Commissioner of the Revenue for Wythe County, for tax purposes. It documents the name, gender, residence, and occupation of circa 29 free African Americans living in Wythe County in 1838.

controlaccess.head: Genre and Form Terms:
controlaccess.genreform: Free negro and slave records--Virginia--Wythe County.
